column1: Quy Nhơn (IPA-vi|kwi ɲəːŋ|lang|) is a coastal city in Bình Định Province in central Vietnam. It is composed of 16 wards and five communes with a total of 284 km2 (110 sq mi). Quy Nhơn is the capital of Bình Định Province. As of 2009 its population was 280
column3: the commercial activities of the city focused on agriculture and fishing. In recent years
column5: there has been a significant shift towards service industries and tourism. There is also a substantial manufacturing sector.

column1: == History ==
The town of Quy Nhơn was officially founded in the late 18th century
column2: although its origins stretch back much further to the 11th-century Champa culture
column3: the Tây Sơn dynasty and the 18th century seaport of Thị Nại. During the 1620s the town was host to Portuguese Jesuits who called the place Pulo Cambi.

column1: During the Ming treasure voyages of the 15th century
column2: the Chinese fleet led by Admiral Zheng He would always make port at Quy Nhơn in Champa as their first destination after leaving China.The city is renowned as the birthplace of 18th century Vietnamese emperor Nguyễn Huệ and
column4: had a large American military presence during the Vietnam War. Today the city is recognized as a first class city with a geo-economic priority and an urbanized infrastructure. The government describes it as one of the three commercial and tourism centres of the central southern coastal region (with Đà Nẵng and Nha Trang).

column1: == Geography ==
Quy Nhơn has a varied topography
column2: being extremely diversified with mountains and forests
column11: peninsulas and islands. Its coastline is 42 km long with sandy beaches
column12: abundant seafood resources and other natural products of economic value.

column1: The city has sixteen wards: Trần Hưng Đạo
column15: Bùi Thị Xuân and Trần Quang Diệu. It has five villages: Nhơn Lý
column18: Nhơn Hải and Phước Mỹ (which was spun off from Tuy Phước District and merged into Quy Nhơn city in 2006) with a total area of 284.28 km² and a population of about 284

column1: == Transportation ==
Quy Nhơn is served by Vietnam Airlines
column3: VietJet Air and Pacific Airlines through Phù Cát Airport
column4: with flights to Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City.Quy Nhơn railway station could be reached by a branch off the main line of the North–South railway
column5: but this line was suspended in May 2016. Reunification express trains stop only in Diêu Trì railway station
column6: which is around 10 km west of Quy Nhơn.

column1: == Economy ==
Quy Nhơn is one of the main industrial centres of the South Central Coast
column2: behind only Đà Nẵng and Nha Trang. It is also the major industrial and service centre of Bình Định Province
column3: including its largest industrial facilities at Phu Tai Industrial Park and Nhơn Hội Economic Zone. The city's economic activities include industries
column6: aquatic product husbandry and tourism. The economic trend
column8: is increasingly service-based at the expense of agriculture

column1: Cereals are cultivated on 2548 ha of Quy Nhơn's land with an output of 13
column3: just 2% of the province's total. Other crops included 10
column7: as well as smaller amounts of coconuts
column8: peanuts and cashew nuts.Much of the city's industry is concentrated in and around Phu Tai Industrial Park in the west of the city along National Route 1A. Quy Nhơn is a major centre of garden furniture manufacturing. It has traditionally been relying on access to wood from Bình Định's forests as well as the Central Highlands provinces of Gia Lai and Kon Tum and even as far as Cambodia's Ratanakiri and Laos' Attapeu Province. Most of the furniture factories are located in Phu Tai Industrial Park. Several chemical enterprises that supply the furniture and wood processing industry have been set up in the vicinity of the industrial park.Other industries in Quy Nhơn process agricultural and aquatic products
column9: or produce construction materials and paper products. Bidiphar is a pharmaceutical company headquartered in Quy Nhơn that is an exception to the city's general focus on basic and wood processing industries. Nhơn Hội Economic Zone is central to the city's and province's industrial development plans. However
column10: as of late 2010 it was still in the early stages of development

column1: Quy Nhơn has seen only limited foreign investment. As of 2008
column2: 13 foreign companies employed 1119 people in the city.Currently the economic structure of Quy Nhơn is a shift towards increasing the proportion of service industries
column4: forestry and fisheries in GDP. The shares of agriculture
column5: forestry and fisheries – industrial and construction – services in GDP in 2006 reached 36.7%

== Climate ==
Quy Nhơn has a tropical savanna climate (Köppen climate classification: As).
== Education ==
Quy Nhơn has two universities: Quy Nhơn University and Quang Trung University. As of 2009 they had a total teaching staff of 601 and 23
column4: 704 of whom were female. There were 19

column1: == Cuisine ==
Quy Nhơn is home to multiple Vietnamese domestically famous dishes:
Bánh xèo tôm nhảy (jumping-shrimps fried pancake): These pancakes are made with special formulas and each restaurant has its own way of making distinguished dipping fish sauce for this dish.
Bánh hỏi cháo lòng: The dish composes of two sub-dishes: "Bánh hỏi" (a type of rice cake in Vietnam) and "cháo lòng" (pig's internal organs porridge).
Bún chả cá (fish-cake rice vermicelli).
Chả ram tôm đất (shrimp spring roll).
